article_title: Rapper’s Murder Sparks Protests in Greece
article_text:
Greece’s prime minister is appealing for calm. Antonis Samaras said Thursday that his government would not allow the “successors of the Nazis” to destabilize Greece.”

His message comes after violent protests in cities across Greece last night, in response to the stabbing murder of anti-fascist rapper, Pavlos Fyssas, who goes by stage name Killah P — allegedly by a member of the country’s far-right Golden Dawn party.

Guest

article_metadata.description: The stabbing murder of an anti-fascist rapper -- allegedly by a member of the country's neo-Nazi Golden Dawn party -- sparked violent protests in cities across Greece last night.

og.description: The stabbing murder of an anti-fascist rapper -- allegedly by a member of the country's neo-Nazi Golden Dawn party -- sparked violent protests in cities across Greece last night.
